comments.text:
What if, just what if, first time at bat Disney creates an episode superior 
in every way to any episode created or imagined so far by Lucas? 
Screenplay, music, sheer power and scope, graphics, costumes, everything. 
Now that would be a profound disturbance in the Force. I will bet it 
happens. 
Star Wars with a vastly superior, fully functioning operating system. I am 
already looking forward to Episode VIII.﻿

"Among us there are humans that are skillfully intelligent, hyper 
intuitive, and masterfully creative. They are impervious to the 
manipulation, immune to the programming, and genetically engineered for 
resistance. Often referred to as some to be the different, the odd, or the 
weird. Not understood by most. Often isolationist, the world can be 
confusing for them. They tend to have a great love for the beautiful things 
in life. A passionate care for nature, music, and art. They don't 
understand why many around them don't resonate with the same vibrations. 
They draw most of their power from connection with their own kind. They 
feed off each other’s intuition, inspiration, and motivation. And they 
almost always have an incredible compulsive desire to".. - Help –﻿

comments.text:
I find it sad that most "fans" are hyped not because there is going to be 
another Star Wars film; but because people are hating on the prequels, and 
keep saying this is the movie they "want."  I saw a comment that said 
something along the lines of, "We're finally getting a fourth Star Wars 
movie."  It's just sad that people can't enjoy the saga in it's entirety. 
 I for one am excited that we have six amazing films, and will soon be 
getting nine!﻿

comments.author: Estevan Depintor

comments.text:
+Ethan C. You know, a lot of people complained the same way when Clone Wars 
came out. Not defending Rebels, just putting it out there.
comments.author: Augie Spendley

comments.text:
+Ethan C.​ You do realize, don't you, that the *exact same team* is working 
on Rebels that did Clone Wars... The only reason they canceled Clone Wars 
was because Cartoon Network wouldn't let them do it anymore. So, they came 
up with a new idea, and switched projects, but it's almost all the same 
people, including writers.﻿

The Clone Wars had some pretty awful episodes, but altogether, the series 
was awesome. You have to look at Rebels in the same way: you're watching 
the actual formation of the Rebel Alliance! There is always a lot of 
exposition on the first season, and things don't really start getting good 
until the second. They're bringing in Darth freaking Vader for season 2!!! 
As well as *several* characters from Clone Wars (Ahsoka, Captain Rex, 
Hondo, and maybe others, if the rumors are true). I don't think the series 
will have a problem living up to the standards of Clone Wars.

I must admit though, that some of the character animations, particularly 
the wagging jaw whenever someone talks, is disappointing.
